headline: Why TJX Companies' Stock Is Sinking Today
summary: While Q1 performance came in ahead of expectations, the stock is losing ground because of management's guidance.  TJX's earnings-per-share target for this year came in significantly below the average analyst estimate.  The stock of TJX Companies (NYSE: TJX) is moving lower Wednesday on the heels of the company's first-quarter report.

headline: Bitcoin, UnitedHealth, TJX guidance, CoreWeave: Market Minute
summary: Yahoo Finance host Brad Smith tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including bitcoin's (BTC-USD) climb to a new record high just below $110,000, UnitedHealth Group's (UNH) stock reaction a new Guardian report, TJX Companies (TJX) issuing soft guidance amid tariff concerns, and CoreWeave (CRWV) getting a stock boost after Citi analysts raised their price target. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Tariffs, inflation and leery customers are hitting retailers in different ways
summary: Retailers are trying to navigate their way through economic uncertainty in 2025.  Tariffs, inflation and lingering fears of a recession have left many Americans uneasy and pulling back on spending.  Because consumer spending accounts for about 70% of U.S. economic activity, a retreat would heighten the odds of contraction for the U.S. economy.

headline: Target Stock Drops After Retailer Flags Waning Consumer Confidence
summary: A handful of retailers, including Walmart, have so far announced plans to raise prices because of tariffs. On Wednesday, Target said it aims to keep price rises as small as possible. Still, its shares sank almost 5% in morning trading.

headline: TJX (NYSE:TJX) Posts Better-Than-Expected Sales In Q1
summary: Off-price retail company TJX (NYSE:TJX) reported Q1 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 5.1% year on year to $13.11 billion. On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $13.8 billion was less impressive, coming in 2% below analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $0.92 per share was in line with analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: TJX (NYSE:TJX) Posts Better-Than-Expected Sales In Q1
raw.summary: Off-price retail company TJX (NYSE:TJX) reported Q1 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 5.1% year on year to $13.11 billion. On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $13.8 billion was less impressive, coming in 2% below analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $0.92 per share was in line with analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Off-price retailer TJX beats sales estimate as tariff uncertainty looms large
summary: (Reuters) -TJX Cos maintained its annual forecast on Wednesday and flagged an impact from U.S. tariffs, while resilient consumer demand for off-price goods amid an uncertain economy drove a quarterly sales beat for the TJ Maxx parent.  TJX reaffirmed its fiscal 2026 forecast for comparable sales growth at 2% to 3% and earnings per share between $4.34 and $4.43.  The company said the annual forecast assumes that it can offset the significant incremental pressure it has experienced and continues to expect from tariffs.

raw.headline: Off-price retailer TJX beats sales estimate as tariff uncertainty looms large
raw.summary: (Reuters) -TJX Cos maintained its annual forecast on Wednesday and flagged an impact from U.S. tariffs, while resilient consumer demand for off-price goods amid an uncertain economy drove a quarterly sales beat for the TJ Maxx parent.  TJX reaffirmed its fiscal 2026 forecast for comparable sales growth at 2% to 3% and earnings per share between $4.34 and $4.43.  The company said the annual forecast assumes that it can offset the significant incremental pressure it has experienced and continues to expect from tariffs.
